entity1.name: Atlantis
entity1.description: A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, often associated with advanced civilization and sudden destruction.;;;A legendary island civilization mentioned in Plato's works, often associated with advanced technology and knowledge.;;;A legendary island civilization mentioned in Plato's works, described as a powerful and advanced society that existed thousands of years ago.;;;A legendary ancient civilization believed to have existed and then disappeared, often associated with advanced technology and great wealth.;;;A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, often associated with a lost civilization.;;;A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, described as a powerful and advanced civilization that sank into the ocean.;;;A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, often associated with advanced ancient civilizations and sudden catastrophic destruction.;;;A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, often associated with a lost civilization or utopia.;;;A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, known for its sudden and catastrophic destruction.;;;A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, believed by some to have existed in the Atlantic Ocean.;;;A legendary island mentioned in Plato's works, often the subject of speculation and theories about its existence and location.;;;A land area surrounded by water, mentioned to be rich in resources and technologically advanced.;;;A legendary island mentioned by Plato, said to have sunk into the ocean in a single day and night.;;;A legendary island first mentioned by the ancient Greek philosopher Plato.

entity2.name: Plato
entity2.description: An ancient Greek philosopher, known for his contributions to philosophy and the founding of the Academy in Athens.;;;An ancient Greek philosopher who is credited with the creation of the Atlantis myth in his dialogues 'Timaeus' and 'Critias'.;;;An ancient Greek philosopher, known for his contributions to philosophy and the concept of ideal forms.;;;An ancient Greek philosopher who first mentioned Atlantis in his dialogues.;;;An ancient Greek philosopher who is a central figure in the development of Western philosophy.
entity2.chunkid: The Legend of Atlantis1;;;The Legend of Atlantis20;;;The Legend of Atlantis2;;;The Legend of Atlantis6;;;The Legend of Atlantis10;;;The Legend of Atlantis4

entity3.name: Timaeus
entity3.description: One of the dialogues by Plato where he mentions the island of Atlantis.

entity4.name: Critias
entity4.description: Another dialogue by Plato that discusses the story of Atlantis.

entity9.name: Atlantic Ocean
entity9.description: The second-largest of the world's oceans, located between the Americas to the west and Europe and Africa to the east.
entity9.chunkid: The Legend of Atlantis4;;;The Legend of Atlantis16

entity14.name: Pillars of Hercules
entity14.description: An ancient term for the promontories that flank the entrance to the Strait of Gibraltar, marking the boundary between the Mediterranean Sea and the Atlantic Ocean.

entity15.name: Strait of Gibraltar
entity15.description: A narrow strait that connects the Atlantic Ocean to the Mediterranean Sea and separates Spain from Morocco.

entity17.name: Atlanteans
entity17.description: A group of people described as initially noble and virtuous, but who later became corrupt and power-hungry, leading to their downfall.

entity27.name: Mediterranean Sea
entity27.description: A sea connected to the Atlantic Ocean, surrounded by the Mediterranean Basin and almost completely enclosed by land: on the north by Southern Europe and Anatolia, on the south by North Africa, and on the east by the Levant.

entity28.name: Antarctica
entity28.description: The southernmost continent on Earth, containing the South Pole. It is situated in the Antarctic region of the Southern Hemisphere, almost entirely south of the Antarctic Circle, and is surrounded by the Southern Ocean.

entity29.name: lost civilization
entity29.description: A hypothetical or legendary society that is believed to have existed in the past but has since disappeared without a trace.
